data.title: Rural Municipality Of Meota, SK
data.meta_description: The Rural Municipality of Meota No. 468 is situated North of the Battlefords, and within its boundaries Jackfish Lake and Murray Lake are at the center
data.text:
​

OFFICIAL COMMUNITY PLAN AND ZONING BYLAW ADOPTION​

Public Notice is hereby given that the Council for the RM of Meota No. 468 (RM) intends to consider the adoption of new land use planning bylaws, an Official Community Plan (OCP) and a Zoning Bylaw (ZB), under sections 29 and 46 of The Planning and Development Act, 2007 (PDA). Council will hold a public hearing on Wednesday, September 25, 2024, at 8:00 AM in the RM office. Please click on "Download Here" for more information

​

Download Here

OCP & ZONING BYLAW REVIEW AND UPDATE

The RM of Meota No. 468 Council is reviewing and updating their Official Community Plan (OCP) and Zoning Bylaw. The current bylaws were approved in 2011, and therefore need updating to reflect current trends and regulations. Please click on "Download Here" for more information.

​

Download Here

BURN PERMIT AUTHORIZATION HOTLINE

The RM of Meota consulted with the Fire Chief to streamline the approval process for controlled burns. Burn Permits from the RM office are no longer required, however residents still require authorization to burn.

Two Steps are required for authorization to complete a controlled burn:

Step 1: Contact the 24-hour RM Burn Authorization Hotline at 1-306-892-2221

​

*Leave a message with

*Your Name

*Your Cell Phone Number

*Location of the Burn

*Date of the Burn

​

Once you leave a message you are authorized by the RM to Burn. The Fire Chief will receive a notification and may contact you to revoke the authorization if unsafe conditions are present. If a Fire Ban is in place the 24 hour RM Hotline message will indicate that controlled burns are currently not allowed

Step 2: Contact the 24-hour Provincial Controlled Burn Line @ 1-866-404-4911

For More Information see the attached information sheet developed by the

Public Safety Agency

SASKATCHEWAN LOTTERIES COMMUNITY GRANT

The RM of Meota is extending the deadline for applications under the Saskatchewan Lotteries Community Grant Program to 4:30 p.m. March 15, 2024 for projects occurring between April 1, 2024 and March 31, 2025. Applicants are encouraged to review the attached guidelines to ensure their project expenses are eligible.

The Saskatchewan Lotteries Community Grant Program assists in the development of sport, culture and recreation programs by providing funds to nonprofit community organizations operated by volunteers. The grant program is a partnership between the Government of Saskatchewan, Sask Sport Inc., SaskCulture Inc. and the Saskatchewan Parks and Recreation Association Inc. The RM of Meota has been allocated $8,824 for the 2024 Fiscal Year.

For more information, contact the CAO at 306-892-2061.

Please click on "Download Here" for access to the application form and guidelines.

​

Download Here

CLAY CAP MATERIAL

The RM of Meota was successful in obtaining a grant through the Rural Integrated Roads for Growth (RIRG) program to rehabilitate the Jackfish grid from 3.2 km north of Hwy 26 to 9.0 km north of Hwy 26. Please click on "Download Here" for further information.

Download Here

​

SASKATCHEWAN LOTTERIES COMMUNITY GRANT

​

The Saskatchewan Lotteries Community Grant Program assists in the development of sport, culture and recreation programs by providing funds to nonprofit community organizations operated by volunteers. The grant program is a partnership between the Government of Saskatchewan, Sask Sport Inc., SaskCulture Inc. and the Saskatchewan Parks and Recreation Association Inc. The RM of Meota has been allocated $8,824 for the 2024 Fiscal Year.

​

The RM of Meota is accepting applications for funding from interested community organizations within the RM of Meota.

Applications will be accepted on or before 4:30 p.m. Feb 1, 2024 for projects occurring between April 1, 2024 and March 31, 2025.

The Application Form and Guidelines are attached below. Please click on "Download Here" to access the application form and guidelines.

For more information, contact the CAO at 306-892-2061.

​

Download Here
